docs.snippet: On Thursday, Democrats will have their best chance to topple one of President Trump’s cabinet choices when Andrew F. Puzder testifies before the Senate.

headline.print_headline: Democrats Set Their Sights on Blocking President’s Pick for Labor Secretary
headline.main: Democrats Set Sights on Blocking Trump’s Labor Secretary Pick

docs.snippet: Thursday: The city’s delicious chocolate history, numbing weather, and a 75th birthday in Crosswords.

headline.print_headline: New York Today: City of Chocolate
headline.main: New York Today: City of Chocolate

docs.snippet: Progressives are exchanging civil disobedience tactics, pooling resources and attending demonstrations about issues that they may not have previously focused on.

headline.print_headline: Activists for Liberal Causes Join Forces Against Common Foe: Trump
headline.main: Liberal Activists Join Forces Against a Common Foe: Trump

docs.snippet: Is a new chief executive’s zeal enough to save an empire that once propelled the national conversation but has been struggling for relevance in the digital era?

headline.main: Time Inc. Plots a Future Beyond Its Heyday, as Suitors Line Up

docs.snippet: Before you travel, here’s some information on what border agents can and cannot do, along with recommendations from lawyers.

headline.print_headline: You’re at the Border. What Are Your Rights?
headline.main: What Are Your Rights if Border Agents Want to Search Your Phone?

docs.snippet: The White House press secretary, Sean Spicer, laid out the timeline of when President Trump learned of Michael T. Flynn’s discussion of sanctions with Russia’s envoy.

headline.main: Trump Was Informed 17 Days Ago That Flynn Had Not Been Truthful on Russia

docs.snippet: Demonstrators hurled stones and burned tires outside an electric company near a refugee community to voice their displeasure with worsening power shortages.

headline.print_headline: In the Dark for Most of Their Days, Gazans Rally Against Power Cuts
headline.main: With Electricity in Short Supply, 10,000 Protest in Gaza, Defying Hamas

docs.snippet: Ten years ago, the financier Stephen A. Schwarzman was vilified for his lavish 60th bash; this year, in the Trump era, things seem to have changed.

headline.main: A Billionaire’s Party Is a Lens on Wealth in the Trump Era

docs.snippet: When one of your jobs has been running your own fashion label, separation is more complicated than it sounds.

headline.main: Should Ivanka Trump the Woman Wear Ivanka Trump the Brand?

docs.snippet: The top prize in this year’s World Press Photo contest was given to a dramatic image of the assassination of Russia’s ambassador to Turkey.
docs.abstract: The top prize in this year’s World Press Photo contest was given to a dramatic image of the assassination of Russia’s ambassador to Turkey.
